The Global Compact in the Nordic Countries

The Global Compact Nordic Network is one of the first local network that was formed. Companies from Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden initially formed the Nordic Network (GCNN) as a forum to discuss the implementation of the Global Compact. The network has since then held regular meetings twice a year, forming working groups and organising other Global Compact related activities. A recent event included a seminar on human rights and responsibility in the supply chain.

In 2007, network meetings were held in Oslo and in Stockholm.

Countries forming the GC Nordic Network - GCNN:

Denmark, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Iceland
